Driver description¶

The cdb_driver command includes many options. Its help command lists:

$ cdb_driver --help
usage: cdb_driver [options] diagnostic

This script sets up and run a diagnostic on the CMIP5 archive

Created scripts might require:
NCO 4.0.8 w/ OPeNDAP, netCDF4/HDF5
CDO 1.5.1 w/ OPeNDAP, netCDF4/HDF5
gnu-parallel

positional arguments:
  diag_header

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit

Setup:
  These options must be set when using this script

  --debug               Debug flag. Disables options --y_async and
                        --dim_async.

Processing:
  Use these options to set parallelized options.
                               BEWARE! Asynchronous options are largely untested!

  -P, --pbs_expt        Prepare a pbs header for each model/run_id/experiment
  -w WALLTIME, --walltime WALLTIME
                        pbs job walltime. Inactive for now: Determined by
                        queue
  -q QUEUE, --queue QUEUE
                        PBS queue
  -S, --submit          PBS queue
  --y_async Y_ASYNC     Uses the specified # of processors for the
                        asynchronous processing of years. Cannot be used with
                        --dim_async. Requires NCO version 4.0.0 and above,
                        gnu-parallel.
  --dim_async DIM_ASYNC
                        Uses the specified # of processors in dimension
                        splitting. Cannot be used with --y_async. Requires NCO
                        version 4.0.0 and above, gnu-parallel.

Frederic Laliberte, Paul J. Kushner, University of Toronto, 12/2012

The cdb_driver takes as an argument a header file that was pre-processed by cdb_query_archive optimset_months and returns bash scripts for each model, rip, experiment combination.

There are two groups of optional arguments: Setup and Processing.

Setup¶

In the Setup options, one can specify a debug mode or one can request that the created scripts be run by the driver by using the option run.

Processing¶

Processing options are offering possibilities for asynchronous computing and sumitting jobs through a PBS scheduler. These options are still in alpha phase and can be treacherous to use. A full documentation will become available when the implementation will be more stable.

    • Processing
